Description: Fragment of rim and wall of East Greek pottery plate; dull grey-brown clay with much chalky inclusions and some mica; underside reserved; dots on outside of rim; top of rim and floor slipped white; maeander on rim; uncertain motif on floor, probably part of animal, with a little added red; fringe of tongues around part of periphery; part of volute-star at left edge.
Curator's comments: An unusual piece, both for fabric and iconography. Either East Dorian or North Ionian.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.557)
